episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including a unique language in Papua New Guinea used for nut gathering, the invention of a cheese that doesn't mold by a man from a place called Mold, a suggestion to rewrite Darwin's "On the Origin of Species" to focus solely on pigeons, and the role of a royal anagramist in the court of King Louis XIII of France.

facts.fact: There is a special language in Papua New Guinea that is only used when gathering nuts.
The man who worked out how to stop soft cheese going moldy came from a place called Mold.
When Charles Darwin submitted On the Origin of Species to his publisher, the publisher suggested he should rewrite it exclusively about pigeons.
King Louis the 13th of France had a royal anagramist.
